clinical_study.brief_title: Risk Factors of Preterm Birth Born in Hospital：a Prospective Multicenter Case-control Study
clinical_study.official_title: Risk Factors of Preterm Birth Born in Hospital：a Prospective Multicenter Case-control Study

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to explore the perinatal risk factors of preterm birth in China.

detailed_description.textblock: Preterm birth is a global scourge, and the leading cause of newborn deaths (babies in the first 4 weeks of life) and raised to the leading cause of death among children under 5 years of age, responsible for approximately 1 million deaths in 2015. In China, the prevalence of preterm increased from 4~5% in 1990s to 7~10% in 2010. Preterm birth become a burden to both the family and society. Therefore, the risk factors of preterm birth become the critical issue of both Obstetrics and Neonatology. More importantly, few multicenter prospective studies on risk factors of preterm birth included potential reasons such as maternal occupation, psychology condition and lifestyles during pregnancy were conducted in China. Thus, the aim of our study is to explore the perinatal risk factors of preterm birth nowadays in China.

secondary_outcome.description: Infant's weight recorded at the time of birth
the number of completed weeks of gestation, which was determined by the duration of menorrhoea or confirmed by an early ultrasound scan during pregnancy

determined by evaluating the newborn baby on five simple criteria（Appearance, Pulse, Grimace, Activity, Respiration） on a scale from zero to two, then summing up the five values thus obtained. The resulting Apgar score ranges from zero to 10.

determined by evaluating the newborn baby on five simple criteria（Appearance, Pulse, Grimace, Activity, Respiration） on a scale from zero to two, then summing up the five values thus obtained. The resulting Apgar score ranges from zero to 10.
a birth weight below the 10th percentile for the gestational age

arm_group.description: All the live-born infants with gestational age less than 37weeks and more than 20weeks born in the cooperative hospital every day or every two or three days.
The one next-live-born infants with gestational age at 37weeks or more than 37weeks.

study_pop.textblock: Live-born preterm infants and one term infants born following the preterm infants in the same cooperation hospitals

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Live-born infants >20weeks of gestational age
Exclusion Criteria:
- Stillbirth
